Welcome to toliman’s documentation!¶

About¶

This documentation was written by Benjamin Pope, so you can blame him for missing content.

Introduction¶

TOLIMAN is a telescope concept aimed at detecting planets around Alpha Centauri A and B via their effects on the relative astrometry between these two stars. We need to measure the separation (4 arcseconds) to better than 1 microarcsecond!

We will do this using a diffractive pupil, which imprints a characteristic diffraction pattern on the light before it ever encounters optical aberrations inside the telescope.

Software¶

This initial TOLIMAN simulation package is written in Python using poppy, a physical optics simulation package. Most of the important detail is in Jupyter notebooks, which have the advantage of being fun and interactive. We expect to migrate to more classical Python libraries when we need to move to more serious simulations.
